author: hansbak
msg: Return a 404 error and not redirect to control main in the ecommerce: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OFBIZ-4390

author: saya
msg: changed jdbm partition test to use the partition interface and operation execution manager when doing queries and modifiications.

A problem I detected was the possible inconsistency when reading btree redirects from anohter btree. Say we have Btree A and one of the records of this btree points to Btree B. We open a browser on tree A as of time 10. Then at some time we read a pointer to Btree B. From BTree A, we get this pointer as of time 10 and then use it to read Btree B say at time 15.. However, the new search for BTree B will as of time 15 and by that time that pointer might have been assigned to some other object.  This is unlikely but the possibility is there. To work around this problem we avoid deleting the Btree pointer from the underlying record manager even when Btree B is deleted. This is just a work around and there should be a better way to solve this problem.

author: bodewig
msg: produces a different set of jars now

author: saya
msg: With txn layer changes, when entries are being modified, they are firt cloned. So entries cached at jdbm layer will not be modified directly. So it is not necessary to do deep copy at jdbm layer anymore.
